Container.Name: LibreChat
Container.Overview:
LibreChat brings together the future of assistant AIs with the revolutionary technology of OpenAI's ChatGPT. Celebrating the original styling, LibreChat gives you the ability to integrate multiple AI models. It also integrates and enhances original client features such as conversation and message search, prompt templates and plugins.
https://docs.librechat.ai/

Config.Name: Port UI
Config.Description: Port for LibreChat UI

Config.Name: Crypto Key
Config.Description: A 32-byte hexadecimal key used for cryptographic operations.

Config.Name: Crypto Initialization Vector
Config.Description: A 16-byte hexadecimal initialization vector for crypto operations.

Config.Name: MongoDB URI
Config.Description: Connection URI for MongoDB database. Format: mongodb://ip:port/database

Config.Name: JWT Secret
Config.Description: Secret key for JSON Web Token (JWT) authentication.

Config.Name: JWT Refresh Secret
Config.Description: Secret key for JWT refresh tokens.

Config.Name: Email From Address
Config.Description: The email address used in the 'From' field in outgoing emails.

Config.Name: Email Service Provider
Config.Description: Service provider for sending emails (e.g., Gmail, Yahoo).

Config.Name: Email Username
Config.Description: Username for the email service provider account.

Config.Name: Email Password
Config.Description: (App) Password for the email service provider account.

Config.Name: OpenAI API Key
Config.Description: API key for accessing OpenAI services.

Config.Name: Enable Email Login
Config.Description: Toggle to enable (true) or disable (false) login via email.

Config.Name: Enable Email Registration
Config.Description: Toggle to enable (true) or disable (false) user registration via email.

Config.Name: Enable Social Login
Config.Description: Toggle to enable (true) or disable (false) login using various social networks.

Config.Name: Enable Social Registration
Config.Description: Toggle to enable (true) or disable (false) user registration using social networks.

Config.Name: Client Domain
Config.Description: Specifies the domain name used for the client-side of the application. It's the domain that users interact with in their browser. This should match the public-facing URL of your reverse proxy or load balancer, ensuring that all client-side redirects and requests use this domain. For instance, if your reverse proxy domain for the client interface is https://chat.domain.com, then DOMAIN_CLIENT should be set to this URL.

Config.Name: Server Domain
Config.Description: Defines the domain name used for server-side operations. It's crucial for internal communications and redirects that happen on the server side of the application. This should be set to the domain or URL where the server is accessible, especially in cases where different domains are used for client and server parts of the application. Similar to DOMAIN_CLIENT, if your server is accessed through https://api.domain.com, then set DOMAIN_SERVER to this URL.

Config.Name: Debug Logging Enabled
Config.Description: Enables debug logging

Config.Name: DALL-E API Key
Config.Description: OpenAI API key for DALL-E / DALL-E-3. If you want to provide your own key for all users you can add your OpenAI API key here.

Config.Name: Enable Titling Conversations
Config.Description: Titling is enabled by default when initiating a conversation. Set to false to disable this feature

Config.Name: OpenAI Title Model
Config.Description: The default model used for titling by is gpt-3.5-turbo. You can change it by setting the desired model. (Optional)

Config.Name: OpenAI Summarization
Config.Description: Enable message summarization by uncommenting the following (Optional/Experimental) Note: this may affect response time when a summary is being generated.

Config.Name: Google Search API Key
Config.Description: Google Search API Key. https://developers.google.com/custom-search/v1/introduction

Config.Name: Google Custom Search Engine ID
Config.Description: Search Engine ID

Config.Name: OpenID Client ID
Config.Description: The client identifier assigned by the OpenID provider upon registration of the application.

Config.Name: OpenID Client Secret
Config.Description: The client secret assigned by the OpenID provider, used to authenticate the identity of the application to the provider.

Config.Name: OpenID Issuer URL
Config.Description: The URL of the OpenID provider's configuration document.

Config.Name: OpenID Session Secret
Config.Description: A secret string used to sign the session identifier, enhancing security around sessions.

Config.Name: OpenID Scope
Config.Description: Specifies the scope of access requests, such as openid, profile, and email. This determines the level of access and the type of information the application can retrieve from the OpenID provider.

Config.Name: OpenID Callback URL
Config.Description: The URL to which the OpenID provider redirects the user after authentication. It must match one of the allowed callback URLs configured in the OpenID application settings.

Config.Name: OpenID Button Label
Config.Description: Text label for the OpenID login button, customizable to fit the application's user interface.

Config.Name: OpenID Button Image URL
Config.Description: URL of an image to be used for the OpenID login button, allowing customization of the button's appearance.

Config.Name: Session Expiry Time
Config.Description: Duration (in milliseconds) after which the session expires.

Config.Name: Refresh Token Expiry Time
Config.Description: Duration (in milliseconds) after which the refresh token expires.

Config.Name: Email Encryption Type
Config.Description: Type of encryption for email delivery (e.g., starttls, tls).

Config.Name: Email Server Port
Config.Description: Port number for the email server.

Config.Name: Email Server Host
Config.Description: Hostname of the email server (e.g., smtp.example.com).

Config.Name: Enable Redis
Config.Description: Enables or Disables use of Redis

Config.Name: Redis URI
Config.Description: URI for Redis database. Currently only support on dev version of LibreChat

Config.Name: Available Endpoints
Config.Description: Specifies the AI endpoints that LibreChat can use, such as OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, BingAI, ChatGPT Browser, Google, GPT Plugins, and Anthropic.

Config.Name: Global Proxy
Config.Description: A global proxy setting used by all endpoints if specified.

Config.Name: Azure API Key
Config.Description: API key for accessing Azure OpenAI services.

Config.Name: BingAI Access Token
Config.Description: Token for accessing Bing AI services, including Sydney, jailbreak, and Bing Image Creator.

Config.Name: ChatGPT Reverse Proxy
Config.Description: Reverse proxy URL for ChatGPT endpoint.

Config.Name: Google AI API Key
Config.Description: Key for accessing Google AI services.

Config.Name: OpenRouter API Key
Config.Description: API key for OpenRouter, a service that provides access to various LLMs.

Config.Name: Plugin Models
Config.Description: Specifies the AI models available for plugins in LibreChat.

Config.Name: MeiliSearch Master Key
Config.Description: Master key for accessing MeiliSearch, a search database.

Config.Name: MeiliSearch Host
Config.Description: Host address for MeiliSearch service.

Config.Name: Enable Token Balancing
Config.Description: Enables token credit limiting for the OpenAI/Plugins endpoints
